question: A sum of money amounts to Rs. 9800 after 5 years and Rs. 12005 after 8 years at the same rate of simple interest. The rate of interest per annum is:
answer_description: S.I. for 3 years = Rs. (12005 - 9800) = Rs. 2205.S.I. for 5 years = Rs.2205x 5= Rs. 36753Principal = Rs. (9800 - 3675) = Rs. 6125.Hence, rate =100 x 3675%= 12%6125 x 5Video Explanation:https://youtu.be/UYwiBCRN39s

question: A person borrows Rs. 5000 for 2 years at 4% p.a. simple interest. He immediately lends it to another person at 6% p.a for 2 years. Find his gain in the transaction per year.
answer_description: Gain in 2 years= Rs.5000 x25x2-5000 x 4 x 24100100= Rs. (625 - 400)= Rs. 225.Gain in 1 year = Rs.225= Rs. 112.502Video Explanation:https://youtu.be/zBjcwqIcmL4
